result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael James Jacobson

records.addlTxt:
AMENDED

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  H.T.J. or Kerry J.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:23 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael James Jacobson in court.  Attorney Aaron A. Nelson in court for Michael James Jacobson. There is an agreement. An amended INFO has been filed. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 in 22CF144. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis. The State is in compliance with victim rights. Court withholds entry of judgment in favor of DJOC agreement. Court amends bond.

8:48 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael James Jacobson in court.  Attorney Aaron A. Nelson in court for Michael James Jacobson. Set for a plea. There is an agreement.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
COMPAS. CONFIDENTIAL. arc   c: Clerk of Court e: Atty Nelson and DA
Signed by DE and Atty. hml
Filed by ADA Rockow. km
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

04:01  PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel.   ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson   DF:  Michael James Jacobson appeared.  Atty Nelson notes PH will be a waiver, which DE confirms. Crt finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives preliminary hearing. Crt finds probable cause and binds Def over for trial.  Atty Rockow notes Information will mirror the complaint. Atty Nelson consults with DE who would like to proceed. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Atty Rockow has sent discovery.   Adjourned:  4:05 pm  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 11, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Filed by ADA Rockow. km

The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
